column1: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.

column2: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.

column1: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.

column2: Well done is better than well said.
Quality is not an act, it is a habit.

column3: ['Quotes', 'View the list', 'Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.', 'Theodore Roosevelt']

column1: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.

Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
If you can dream it, you can do it.

column2: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.

column1: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.

column3: ['Future', 'People', 'Government', 'Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.']

column1: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
My attitude is that if you push me towards something that you think is a weakness, then I will turn that perceived weakness into a strength.
Keep a good attitude and do the right thing even when it's hard. When you do that you are passing the test. And God promises you your marked moments are on their way.
The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.
People may hear your words, but they feel your attitude.

column3: ['Quotes', 'View the list', 'For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.', 'Walter Scott']
['Important', 'Ability', 'Equally', 'The meaning of things lies not in the things themselves, but in our attitude towards them.']

['Things', 'Lies', 'Meaning Of', 'Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.']
['You', 'Step', 'Better', 'A positive attitude causes a chain reaction of positive thoughts, events and outcomes. It is a catalyst and it sparks extraordinary results.']
['Thoughts', 'Positive Attitude', 'Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.', 'Albert Einstein']
['Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people whom we personally dislike.', 'Oscar Wilde', 'People', 'Morality']
['You cannot tailor-make the situations in life but you can tailor-make the attitudes to fit those situations.', 'Zig Ziglar', 'Life', 'You']
['Cock your hat - angles are attitudes.', 'Frank Sinatra', 'Hat', 'Your']
['Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal; nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.', 'Thomas Jefferson', 'Man', 'Stop']
['The reactionary is always willing to take a progressive attitude on any issue that is dead.', 'Theodore Roosevelt', 'Dead', 'Always']
["I hope the millions of people I've touched have the optimism and desire to share their goals and hard work and persevere with a positive attitude.", 'Michael Jordan', 'Positive', 'Work']

['Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.', 'Khalil Gibran', 'Life', 'You']
["Stop this attitude that older people ain't any good anymore! We're as good as we ever were - if we ever were any good.", 'Dolly Parton', 'Good', 'People']
["Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.", 'Joel Osteen', 'Positive', 'Life']
['Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.', 'Og Mandino', 'Never', 'New']
['If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters. Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.', 'Colin Powell', 'You', 'Excellence']

column1: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.

Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.

column2: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
I think a lot of times we don't pay enough attention to people with a positive attitude because we assume they are naive or stupid or unschooled.
Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be.

column3: ['Positive', 'Quotes', 'View the list', 'The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.']

column1: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.

You are the sum total of everything you've ever seen, heard, eaten, smelled, been told, forgot - it's all there. Everything influences each of us, and because of that I try to make sure that my experiences are positive.
Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.

column2: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.

column1: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
I feel that sin and evil are the negative part of you, and I think it's like a battery: you've got to have the negative and the positive in order to be a complete person.
In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.

column2: I believe if you keep your faith, you keep your trust, you keep the right attitude, if you're grateful, you'll see God open up new doors.
I've always believed that you can think positive just as well as you can think negative.
A President cannot always be popular.
Your smile will give you a positive countenance that will make people feel comfortable around you.

column3: ['Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.', 'Colin Powell', 'Optimism', 'Force']

column2: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.
You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.

column3: ['Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.', 'Pablo Picasso', 'Value', 'Negative']

column1: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.

Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.

column2: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
column3: ['William Shakespeare', 'Know', 'May', 'It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.']

['Once I knew only darkness and stillness... my life was without past or future... but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.', 'Helen Keller', 'Life', 'Future']
['As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.', 'John F. Kennedy', 'Gratitude', 'Appreciation']

['Seen', 'No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.', 'Aesop', 'Kindness']
['How', 'Act', 'Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.', 'Henry David Thoreau']
['World', 'Live', 'Your', "Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud."]
['Someone', 'Try', 'Cloud', 'In a gentle way, you can shake the world.']

column1: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
column3: ['You', 'Believe', 'Halfway', 'The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.']
['Who', 'Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.', 'Vince Lombardi', 'Excellence']

['Live', 'Facts', 'See', "Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like."]
['Life Is A', 'Way', 'Sorrow', 'Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.']
['Mind', 'Past', 'Dream', 'Find ecstasy in life; the mere sense of living is joy enough.']

column1: Find ecstasy in life; the mere sense of living is joy enough.

How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these.
Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.

This life, which had been the tomb of his virtue and of his honour, is but a walking shadow; a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more: it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.

column3: ['Quotes', 'View the list', "Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'", 'Martin Luther King, Jr.']
['Doing', 'Others', 'Question', 'The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.']

column1: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
What is important in life is life, and not the result of life.
column3: ['Result', 'Important', 'As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.', 'Leonardo da Vinci']
['Happy', 'Well-Spent', 'The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.', 'Carl Jung']
['Person', 'Living', 'Shoe', "If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of."]
['Time', 'You', 'Love Life', 'A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.']

column1: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.
When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.
A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
To me, if life boils down to one thing, it's movement. To live is to keep moving.
The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.
The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.

column3: ['Clouds', 'Tomorrow', 'Evening', 'Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.']
['Power', 'Caring', 'Underestimate', 'A smile is the light in your window that tells others that there is a caring, sharing person inside.']
['Caring', 'Window', 'Person', 'A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.']
['Straight', 'Curve', 'Sets', "They might not need me; but they might. I'll let my head be just in sight; a smile as small as mine might be precisely their necessity."]
['Small', 'Need', 'Sight', 'A smile abroad is often a scowl at home.']
['Abroad', 'Often', 'We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.', 'Mother Teresa']
['Know', 'Shall', 'Jesus wept; Voltaire smiled. From that divine tear and from that human smile is derived the grace of present civilization.', 'Victor Hugo']
['Look back, and smile on perils past.', 'Walter Scott', 'Past', 'Look']
['But God can only smile because only God can know what is coming next.', 'Desmond Tutu', 'God', 'Know']
['Coming', 'A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.', 'William Arthur Ward', 'Kindness']

['Approval', 'Wear a smile and have friends; wear a scowl and have wrinkles.', 'George Eliot', 'Friends']
['A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities.', 'Herman Melville', 'Vehicle', 'Chosen']

column1: Laughter is day, and sobriety is night; a smile is the twilight that hovers gently between both, more bewitching than either.
Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.

column2: Wrinkles will only go where the smiles have been.
A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.

column3: ['A gentle word, a kind look, a good-natured smile can work wonders and accomplish miracles.', 'William Hazlitt', 'Work', 'Look']

['The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment.', 'Samuel Taylor Coleridge', 'Life', 'Happiness']
["What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.", 'Joseph Addison', 'Life', 'Good']
["I'm really exciting. I smile a lot, I win a lot, and I'm really sexy.", 'Serena Williams', 'Sexy', 'Win']

column1: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.

In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.

column3: ['Quotes', 'View the list', 'When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.', 'Henri Nouwen']

['Giving', 'Warm', 'Person', 'The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.']
['Friend', 'Grief', 'Not Knowing', 'Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.']
['Friends', 'Remember', 'Old', 'Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.']
['Possessions', 'Most', 'Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.', 'Jean de La Fontaine']
['True Love', 'True Friendship', 'True', 'A friend in power is a friend lost.']
['Friend', 'Lost', 'The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.', 'Giotto di Bondone']
['Ship', 'It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.', 'Confucius', 'Friends']
['Than', 'The only way to have a friend is to be one.', 'Ralph Waldo Emerson', 'Friend']
['A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.', 'Ralph Waldo Emerson', 'Nature', 'Friend']
['It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.', 'Ralph Waldo Emerson', 'You', 'Old Friends']
['Friends', "A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.", 'Ralph Waldo Emerson', 'Man']
['His', 'The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.', 'Henry David Thoreau', 'Friend']
['Most', 'The language of friendship is not words but meanings.', 'Henry David Thoreau', 'Words']
["Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.", 'Henry David Thoreau', 'Dreams', 'Friends']
['Hopes', 'A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.', 'Henry David Thoreau', 'Life']

column1: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
Our task must be to free ourselves by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature and its beauty.
Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.
In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
God has cared for these trees, saved them from drought, disease, avalanches, and a thousand tempests and floods. But he cannot save them from fools.
Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake.
Words, like nature, half reveal and half conceal the soul within.

column3: ['Quotes', 'View the list', 'The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.', 'Rabindranath Tagore']
['Butterfly', 'Moments', 'Enough', "My soul can find no staircase to Heaven unless it be through Earth's loveliness."]
['Heaven', 'Find', 'Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.', 'Langston Hughes']

column1: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.
Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.
O, wind, if winter comes, can spring be far behind?
The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.
With every drop of water you drink, every breath you take, you're connected to the sea. No matter where on Earth you live. Most of the oxygen in the atmosphere is generated by the sea.
The very winds whispered in soothing accents, and maternal Nature bade me weep no more.

column2: I think that I shall never see a poem lovely as a tree.
In the Spring, I have counted 136 different kinds of weather inside of 24 hours.
Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.

column1: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
When nature has work to be done, she creates a genius to do it.

column2: Occurrences in this domain are beyond the reach of exact prediction because of the variety of factors in operation, not because of any lack of order in nature.

column3: ['You', 'World', 'Change The World', 'It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.']
['Educated', 'Without', 'Mark', 'Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and diligence.']

column1: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and diligence.
A person who won't read has no advantage over one who can't read.
I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.
Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
My mother said I must always be intolerant of ignorance but understanding of illiteracy. That some people, unable to go to school, were more educated and more intelligent than college professors.

column3: ['Quotes', 'View the list', 'An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.', 'Benjamin Franklin']
['Knowledge', 'Investment', 'Interest', 'The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically. Intelligence plus character - that is the goal of true education.']
['Intelligence', 'Think', 'True', 'I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.']
['People', 'Something', 'Entertain', 'The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.']

column1: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
Education is the key to unlock the golden door of freedom.
Education is what survives when what has been learned has been forgotten.
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
I tell students that the opportunities I had were a result of having a good educational background. Education is what allows you to stand out.
In the first place, God made idiots. That was for practice. Then he made school boards.
It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.
Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
Intellectual growth should commence at birth and cease only at death.

column2: Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
The things I want to know are in books; my best friend is the man who'll get me a book I ain't read.
